destinations.title: Gulf Shores, Alabama
destinations.description: Boasting over 32 miles of sandy white beaches, Gulf Shores is a mecca of pure paradise on the Alabama coastline. A Gulf Shores vacation home or condo will cost around $400,000, but can yield over $50,000 of rental revenue per year. How's that for Southern hospitality?

destinations.title: Corolla, North Carolina
destinations.description: The popularity of the Outer Banks may have grown given its national exposure on a hit reality show, but those who have been traveling here for years have always admired the area's subtle charm and wide open spaces. The fact that a vacation rental property in Corolla could net you approximately $77,000 in rental revenue per year only shores up the investment.

destinations.title: Navarre Beach, Florida
destinations.description: Here, relaxation is the name of the game, and visitors can mostly be found sunning and swimming in the area's emerald waters. If you're able to scoop up a spot on the sand in Navarre Beach, the median home sale price sits under $400,000, and could bring in an annual rental revenue of $43,202.

destinations.title: New Buffalo, Michigan
destinations.description: The Gateway of Michigan may not immediately strike your fancy as a Best Place to Buy a Beach House, but take a closer look, and you'll find the beach-like lakeshore rivals any destination on our list. With a median home sale price of $569,873 your midwestern escape could earn you just over $58,000 in rental revenue a year. (All the more to adventure with.)
